page.title: 16HUMSHAUGH BUILDINGS
page.content: HUMSHAUGH HAS A TRADITIONAL PATTERN OF STONE BULT{HOUSES}SET ABOUT A MAIN STREET, LANES, AND A FIELD, WITH A MANOR, CHURCH, CHAPEL, SCHOOL, CROWN INN, GENERAL STORES, GPO/SHOP, ALMS- HOUSES AND MODERN HOUSING BORDERING THE ROAD DOWN TO CHOLLERFORD AND THE TYNE. THE VILLAGE HALL, BUILT IN 1928 FOR Â£3,000 IS IN CONSTANT USE. THERE ARE OUTLYING FARMS WITH ARABLE AND PASTURE LAND, COPSES AND WOODLAND; FIELDS DIVIDED BY HEDGES AND DRY STONE WALLS. EASTWARD,{HAUGHTON CASTLE}HAS EXTENSIVE PARKLAND WITH ORNAMENTAL LAKE. SOUTH, AT CHOLLERFORD, IS THE CHESTERS, AN 18TH CENTURY MANSION, THE GEORGE HOTEL, ITS GARDENS BORDER- ING THE RIVER, AND A GARAGE. HERE THE TYNE IS SPANNED BY A BRIDGE BUILT IN 1775, RECENTLY RESTORED. WALWICK AND LINCOLN HILL HOUSES LIE TO THE WEST WHERE THE ROADS LEAD TO{HADRIAN'S WALL
